metatags.og:title: Pushed to Extremes: Domestic Terrorism amid Polarization and Protest
metatags.og:description: The number of domestic terrorist attacks and plots at demonstrations has increased, resulting in escalating violence in U.S. cities between extremists from opposing sides. This analysis updates a CSIS data set to assess trends in domestic terrorism through December 2021.
metatags.twitter:description: The number of domestic terrorist attacks and plots at demonstrations has increased, resulting in escalating violence in U.S. cities between extremists from opposing sides. title: The territorial impact of COVID-19: Managing the crisis across levels ...

snippet: In 2020 COVID-19 affected almost all countries and more than 50 million people around the world. It has governments operating in a context of radical ...
htmlSnippet: In 2020 COVID-19 affected almost all countries and more than 50 million people around the world. It has governments operating in a context of radical ...

metatags.og:title: The territorial impact of COVID-19: Managing the crisis across levels of government
metatags.og:description: COVID-19 has governments at all levels operating in a context of radical uncertainty. The regional and local impact of the COVID-19 crisis is highly heterogeneous, with significant implications for crisis management and policy responses. This paper takes an in-depth look at the territorial impact of the COVID-19 crisis in its different dimensions: health, economic, social and fiscal. It provides examples of responses by national and subnational governments to help mitigate the territorial effects of the crisis, and offers ten takeaways on managing COVID-19’s territorial impact. Finally, the paper offers a forward looking perspective to discuss the crisis’ implications for multi-level governance as well as points for policy-makers to consider as they build more resilient regions.
metatags.twitter:creator: @OECD

metatags.og:description: United States Capitol Madam Speaker, Madam Vice President, our First Lady and Second Gentleman. Members of Congress and the Cabinet. Justices of the Supreme Court. My fellow Americans.   Last year COVID-19 kept us apart. This year we are finally together again.  Tonight, we meet as Democrats Republicans and Independents. But most importantly as Americans.  With a duty to one…
